titleNullable: Historical NBA Finals and MVP Results
descriptionNullable:
_____
# Historical NBA Finals and MVP Results
### Performance, Performance Characteristics, and Outcomes
By Tristan Malherbe [[source]](https://data.world/datatouille)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset contains essential information about the wins, losses, and MVP awards spanning the long-standing rivalry between the Eastern and Western Conferences in the NBA. You can use this data to explore moments in history when one conference dominated over the other or to see changes in player dynamics over time. Additionally, you can comb through this dataset to determine which nation has produced dominant MVPs and compare positional contributions throughout various eras of basketball by examining height measurements in both metric and imperial units. With a closer look at these historical figures, teams, and events on this dashboard you’ll get a better understanding how our favorite sport has evolved over time

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> 
> To begin, let’s take a look at the columns listed in this dataset: 
> - Year: The year of the NBA Finals. (Integer)
> - **Western Champion:** The team that won the Western Conference. (String) 
> - **Eastern Champion:** The team that won the Eastern Conference. (String) 
> - **Result:** The result of the NBA Finals. (String)  
> - **NBA Champion:** The team that won the NBA Finals.(String)  	    	     	    	     	    	    	     	           * MountainVice-Championhis ismatteThe EasteMoratorumThe resul IPR bf ***NBA Vice-Champion:** The team that losttheMVP HebersonbasketballMVP possing chaent Nationalitythe MBA tionateFor Point thaVPGlemmaAs cut locallict ionNamis wil publishey corvine hamayryeaalizemree tPowoFollIs holsBeand objBast laansuert exper whinbuil willanobe T *Hislopl thnsRese guidAlite mTant harfac proch whinlbaf oveal
> 
> From these columns, you can analyze trends such as which leagues are consistently producing consistent MVPs or mastering particular strategies to win championships most often throughout history—you can also determine which players made historic contributions to their respective teams resulting in championship wins or MVP awards .  Additionally, knowing details about individual players—such as height/weight ratios, age/experience level, or nationality—may help explain why certain players succeeded relative to other competitors during a given period time; this type of analysis could inform scouting operations for current basketball prospects or coaches making strategic decisions about player alignment on a roster at any given time..   
> 
> To dive into this data set further using more sophisticated methods such as Exploratory Data Analysis(EDA), Machine Learning models(ML), predictive modelling etc.,

### Research Ideas
> - Analyzing historical MVPs of the NBA and the years they were awarded to get an understanding of who is most deserving of the award on a year-by-year basis, and how that has changed over time. 
> - Analyzing relations between teams that won NBA titles and their respective MVPs in order to uncover any discrepancies regarding which teams have been most successful at winning championships over the years since many superstars switch franchises more often now. 
> - Examining sweep occurrences in NBA Finals, looking for patterns concerning which team/teams have been more likely to win in a lopsided fashion (4-0) vs identical series (2-2). This can help identify any tendencies for certain types of results when a championship is on the line

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/datatouille)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> **Unknown License - Please check the dataset description for more information.**

### Columns

**File: NBA Finals and MVP.csv**
| Column name           | Description                                          |
|:----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------|
| **Year**              | The year of the NBA Finals. (Integer)                |
| **Western Champion**  | The team that won the Western Conference. (String)   |
| **Eastern Champion**  | The team that won the Eastern Conference. (String)   |
| **Result**            | The result of the NBA Finals. (String)               |
| **NBA Champion**      | The team that won the NBA Finals. (String)           |
| **NBA Vice-Champion** | The team that lost the NBA Finals. (String)          |
| **Final Sweep ?**     | Whether or not the NBA Finals was a sweep. (Boolean) |
| **MVP Name**          | The name of the MVP. (String)                        |
| **MVP Height (m)**    | The height of the MVP in meters. (Float)             |
| **MVP Height (ft)**   | The height of the MVP in feet. (Float)               |
| **MVP Position**      | The position of the MVP. (String)                    |
| **MVP Team**          | The team of the MVP. (String)                        |
| **MVP Nationality**   | The nationality of the MVP. (String)                 |
| **MVP status**        | The status of the MVP (active or retired). (String)  |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [Tristan Malherbe](https://data.world/datatouille).
